dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thompson's stride is slowed by the eighty-pound suit...He CLUNKS down the road. Dust clouding from his boots...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves past the same mounds of charred and rotting stuf inner tubes, soda bottles, crumpled cans, steaming animal waste, and bits of fluttering plastic that the bot passed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question is not - do you see a white garbage bag? It' which of these bags is the BOMB?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweat slides down into his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 200 meters. It's boiling in here.   UPRANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy that. 200 meters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RASP of Thompson's BREATHING loud on Sanborn's walkie talkie...   DOWNRANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thompson walks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A knot of flies floats in the air in front of his helmet. lifts an arm and they disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The desert sun glints off a nearby car and momentarily bleaches his mask bright white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG GIRL with an INFANT BABY in her arms appears in a off doorway, then withdraws out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down, CAREFULLY watches his footfalls.   Garbage piled on top of garbage.   UPRANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge and Sanborn are at the ready, scanning the area watching Thompson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy, that. 100 meters out.   DOWNRANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thompson: careful footfalls on sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breathing. Heat.   Sun.   Sweat.   Flies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a DOG out of nowhere charges, BARKING ferociousl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thompson is momentarily startled.    Then resumes his wal The dog runs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thompson blinks more sweat out of his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn lifts the walkie.   Sweat in his eyes.   Wipes it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy twenty five. You're in the kill zone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for reminding me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge nods.   Everything progressing nice and easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thompson is standing over the blasting cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. I'm here. I'm gonna put it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thompson picks the blasting cap off the ground and looks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As distant THUMP of approaching chopper wash quickly beco super loud in his ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on. Bird coming in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thompson pulls the cap back out. He looks up to see the g black shape passing over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Note: we see now what Thompson is worried about: as it c the air, a helicopter rotor produces static electricity. see this electricity as a faint, nearly transparent rippl wave.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy is trying to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter turns, and swings back around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he brings that electricity back here, I'm going to put a bullet in his tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter banks in the other direction, away from Thompson.   UPRANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A collective sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. (into walkie) I think he figured out we were EOD. You're good, Blaster One.   DOWNRANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thompson inserts the cap back into the C4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're armed and ready to blow, Blaster Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy that. You coming back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy that, I'm on my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thompson gets up. Looks around at the expanse of empty, s road under heavy guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The war has stopped for him -- and he knows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thompson begins to walk back uprange, looking carefully a the ground around him.   UPRANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn and Eldridge lower their rifles.   DOWNRANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thompson carefully nudges a Coke can out of the way of hi boots.   UPRANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge turns away from Thompson and opens the HUMVEE tr to stow the bot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn swats a fly and takes a sip of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge loads the bot. Out of the corner of his eye he s some movement in the butcher shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Sanborn --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butcher shop - dude has a phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shouldn't be --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge is already moving towards the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn raises his gun and puts it on the store. The back Eldridge moving in and out of his scope. He can't get a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting, waving his gun) Hey - put that down--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BUTCHER in a white apron nods and puts up his hand as to say, `give me a minute.'     THOMPSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --walking towards the Humvee away from the bomb. Lumberin steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 50 meters. Why is Eldridge running?   ELDRIDGE  --RUNNING HARD--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey - put the phone down!   SANBORN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --bolting sideways trying to get Eldridge out of his line SIGHT--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting to Eldridge)        PUT THE PHONE DOWN! Burn him!   ELDRIDGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --legs pumping, his thumb flicks the rifle safety--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The butcher smiles. Gives Eldridge the thumbs up sign. Hi other thumb is jamming a button on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Eldridge is panicked, shouting:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DROP THE PHONE!!!   THOMPSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --starts to run.   Fear in his eyes.   BUTCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --smiles back at Eldridge--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACRO: thumb on send button of the cell phone.     THOMPSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --running full out now--  BOOM ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Fireball blasts out from the bomb

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- flattening Thompson

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Blood splatters the inside of his helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- thick cloud of particulate matter roils out in slow mo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- hitting Eldridge and Sanborn -- turning them black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the roiling cloud we begin to float up and out over entire city of Baghdad:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --we see intersections jammed with traffic; American Humv and tanks idle next to red-and-white taxis, beat-up Opals the military and civilian mixed up in one snarling line, competing for space, advantage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --we continue to rise until we take in the entire massive metropolis. Mosques and office towers ascend from a maze dusty streets teeming with life despite two decades of wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roiling black cloud thins in a light breeze and we ha CUT TO:  BLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shaft of afternoon sun creeps past a plywood-covered window, faintly lighting the interior of a narrow, low- ceilinged room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dimness we see contours: desk, chair, a large lock and the silhouette of a MAN moving a cot away from the window. On the cot is a small duffle bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a knock from the outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man moving the cot stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant James?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and in the light we see Sanborn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant James. (extending his hand) J.T. Sanborn. Welcome to Bravo Company and welcome to Camp Victory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victory? I thought this was called Camp Liberty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They changed it last week. Victory sounds better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Will. Good to meet you J.T.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERGEANT WILLIAM JAMES extends a hand. A former DELTA soldier is in his late twenties, good-looking, appealing face, solid build, one of the lucky ones. And yet, look closer. In the right light, there's an unusual depth to h expression, to his eyes and all-American face, as if he's guarding an inner chaos that could rush out at any time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now, however, James is doing his best to act like a regular nice guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn looks around the empty room.   One duffle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, is that all you brought from Kabul?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James motions to the locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Here, give me a hand with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn helps James move the locker against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They push the locker over the window, blocking the light. It's very dark in the room now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mortar once hit near my trailer -- boom -- a two inch piece of frag cut through the aluminum and flew this far (gesturing with his hands) over my head, past my balls and landed in my computer hard-drive. Where's the damn light?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn finds the switch in the corner. Then he comes bac and taps the metal locker, testing its strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This should stop any lateral pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm good unless it comes through the roof (smiles) in which case I'm gonna need a closed casket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn doesn't like the joke, tries to change gears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The accent -- you from Georgia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tennessee.     Trailer park off I-5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right. I'm from Vermont. You know, "live free or die." Trees. Snow. Maple syrup. Pot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James gives him a polite smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn soldiers on:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you need anything to get squared away, just let me know. Either myself or Owen -- Eldridge -- be happy to steer you in the right direction for supplies, whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. (pause) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, the mess tent can be hard to find the first time ... so ... if you want ... we're going over there now to grab chow ... come along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. But no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to bring you back a burger or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) Nah. I'm good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James unzips his duffle and gets up to put his clothes on overhead shelf. Sanborn watches him, then starts for the door. James turns to face Sanborn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about Thompson, I heard he was a good tech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he was. And he was a good team leader too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I can't fill his shoes, but I'm here to try--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --but you know, if it's your time it's your time. No man can change that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess that's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, we roll at oh-six-hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James smiles slightly as he contemplates the next day's mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking forward to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn comes out and sees Eldridge, who has been waiting the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk towards the mess tent. Sanborn is absorbed in thought. Eldridge doesn't want to interrupt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A good `ole boy. You know, loves the Army, blood runs green. Country boy. Seems solid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always liked southerners, for some reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he's just your type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is it always the gay jokes with you. It's not even funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (growing serious, he imitates James' accent) It's your time it's your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sand has completed its daily march across Eldridge's steps. His boots sweep a bit away as he steps outside in battle gear, and kisses a photo of the Virgin Mary and sl it inside his helmet. He steps out into the bright mornin sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn is gearing up, strapping on a shitload of weapons ammunition. Ready for anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge comes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the FNG?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Note: FNG. Fucking New Guy.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge, surprised to see James is not outside ready to knocks on his door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's oh-six-hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens a crack, revealing James dressed in his skivvies and wrapped in a blanket, blinking awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Eldridge can express the shock that's written all his face, James has closed the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An American Humvee drives past a long line of parked tank arranged in a neat rows, and gathering dust on all horizo surfaces.   INT HUMVEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn is behind the wheel, simultaneously driving and loading his rifle. James sits next to him in the passenge seat, loading his rifle and looking out the window. Eldri is in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking out window) Those Abrams have been parked ever since I got here nine months ago, and I ain't seen them move once. They should put those on eBay. Hey, J.T., how much you think one of those would cost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten million?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I guess it makes sense. Anybody comes alongside the Humvee, we're dead. Anybody looks at you funny, you're dead. Pretty much, the bottom line, is if you're in Iraq you're dead. How's a tank going to stop that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme a break, Owen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Just trying to scare the new guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Humvee moves out of the base and into the outskirts o the city. Heat and sand and little else.   INT   HUMVEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a few bombs up in Kabul too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, I bet you did. But you're going to be real busy here, boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James smiles, settles back in the seat.   EXT   HUMVEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Humvee is now approaching a cluster of cars.     INT   HUMVEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Owen -- watch the fucking road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge moves up to the gunner's seat on top of the Humv   EXT   HUMVEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge has a collection of rocks he keeps in the gunner nest and now he throws one at the car in front of him. Th passenger turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imshee -- Imshee !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Humvee grinds to a stop on the outskirts of town. It' place teeming with trash, with dwellings that look as bea down as the people. The ghetto of the ghetto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James is first out, Sanborn comes up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge climbs out of the turret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are now out in the open -- standing on Iraqi sand -- where anything can happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge nods and begins turning suspicious bits of plast over with the tip of his boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around at the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the guys who called this in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James walks on. Sanborn and Eldridge exchange a glance `w the hell,' and follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victory Main, Victory Main, this is Blaster Mike. Interogative, Do you have an updated poz for the link- up? Has their position changed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment a scratchy voice over his walkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaster Mike, this is Victory Main. Negative. Figures to follow. Three- four-five-three is your grid. You should have a visual on them right now. They're waving an American

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn keys his GPSw unit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative, Main. No one in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaster Mike. You should have a visual, waving a flag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at empty space) Well, that's were I am and I don't see any guys in fatigues, and I sure as hell don't see any American flag, Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James, Sanborn and Eldridge continue their slow walk down street. An empty Humvee comes into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They abandoned their vehicle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James walks forward. Unconcerned. Takes out a cigarette a lights it. Sanborn's walkie comes to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger, Blaster. I copied you the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James approaches the empty Humvee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stops. Turns to see a tiny American flag being waved in t window of a nearby building. James jogs over to the build opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello boys --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking into a room full of SOLDIERS who are trying not t look afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, thanks. Roger that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me the bomb is in there with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SERGEANT, slightly embarrassed, climbs out into the ope and tries to act nonchalant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points down the block, which is a sea of trash and whi plastic bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing far down the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down on that block, one of our informants says there is an IED in a white plastic bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James has heard enough and even though the Sergeant may h more to say --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get it. (turning to Sanborn) Break out the suit. (turning back to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your guys back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn is already unloading the robot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the bot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Aren't we going to send the bot down to take a look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I'm going to take care of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn shoots Eldridge a look. Is he an FNG or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn and Eldridge kneeling before James, buckling on t suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking if we sent the bot down first --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as he's enclosed in the suit, James moves quickly toward the rubble pile.   UPRANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a rowdy boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's reckless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody should tell the U.N. to send the rice in clear plastic bags so there's no place to hide the IEDs. The insurgent would be like, `Allah has forsaken me all the bags are clear'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Note: IED Improvised Explosive Device. A homemade bomb. number one weapon of the Iraqi insurgency.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen so much garbage I'm starting to like the smell.  JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he advances downrange, he passes a line of bushes and tosses an incendiary grenade at it, setting the foliage ablaze.  UPRANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn looks on in confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaster One, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaster One, this is Blaster Mike, what's with the fire on the side of the road, over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. Sanborn and Eldridge struggle to get a visual. They dash to a better vantage point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey James, can you hear me? What's with the fire on the side of the road, over?  JAMES  FINALLY:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creating a diversion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn can barely see James through the flames and smoke  UPRANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He climbs up on top of the Humvee to get a better look bu gets only a partial view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From what? Is there a threat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge scans the area with his rifle, tense, trying to figure out how to behave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up on that wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge hustles over to the wall, but can't manage to pu himself up with all his gear on, so dashes down to a moun dirt, which gives him a leg up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James, I can't see you, over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last thing he expects is James' laconic reply:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn shoots Eldridge a look - what the fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me what you see, Specialist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge, on the wall, feels awfully vulnerable and in th open. The wall is quite narrow. His feet are precariously balanced. His view of James is not much better

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see his back. He's walking downrange. Oh, I lost him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge, move down that wall and maintain a visual. Move. Move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge teetering down the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger, roger. I'm on him. He's still walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOUND of BREATHING in Sanborn's walkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James, the smoke is killing my visibility. Where are you in relation to the IED? Are you 100 meters, yet?     JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, I don't know. I'll let you know when I'm standing over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the world from James' point of view now, the city Baghdad has taken on an intense and dreamy hue, as if we' in some sort of fugue state:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --He looks down the strange, threatening Iraqi street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks on. The suit is heavy, little puffs of sand with each footfall. The sun beats down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James nears an intersection guarded on either side by a Humvee and several SOLDIERS, when...   INTERSECTION

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a red-and-white TAXI swerves past the SOLDIERS o the left side of the intersection. The soldiers take cove and shout contradictory commands - Get Down Motherfucker! Don't Move! Back up! Out of the vehicle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TAXI BRAKES in front of James.   UPRANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn and Eldridge can hear the shouting but the linger smoke still obscures their sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting to Sanborn) Car! Car! A car stopped in front of him.   JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James' HEADSET WALKIE barks to life:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James pulls a pistol from his holster, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- shoots two rounds into the dirt, near the car's front tire.  DRIVER'S FACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossible to read. Is he a taxi driver annoyed by the roadblock, or an insurgent fighter getting ready to blow suicide bomb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With field glasses on the intersection he speaks into the walkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EOD has a nine on this Haji in the car. I'm going to get two guys over there to back him up.   SANBORN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still can't see clearly. Processing this information.   T to Eldridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge using his rifle scope as well - shakes his head. visual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into walkie to soldier) Negative, negative. You're too close to the IED--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand down. EOD has the situation under control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweat on his forehead.  JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now aiming at the windshield. But the driver is impassive     UPRANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge looks through his rifle scope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting to Sanborn) We're in a kill zone!   INTERSECTION

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James fires, shattering the windshield. But the car doesn budge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James is pissed. He lunges through the windshield and jam his gun into the driver's forehead.  SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three or four rounds fired. The nine is now pressing into the Haji's forehead.  INTERSECTION

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gun digs into the driver's forehead. Beat. The driver shifts into reverse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rolls back to the soldiers, who then rush the car, yan the driver out, and deliver a savage beating as James loo on.   JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckling into his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he wasn't an insurgent he sure as hell is now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he resumes his walk towards the white garbage bag and rubble pile, noting possible threats -- a MAN in a window down the road.  UPRANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coolly, into walkie) Copy that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I have no idea what you're talking about, Blaster One, since I can't see you. Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you later. James out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of a million in this city. James draws near. Two wire protrude from the mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving quickly, he deftly removes rubble and trash to exp the wires and the artillery shells they are attached to - sees out of his peripheral vision the MAN in the window - reaches for his pistol -- but the man disappears from vie he then goes back to work, with swift sure hands. He love this, loves being close to oblivion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wires are exposed. He cuts one. Then flips the artill rounds over and cuts the other wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands and uses his big boot to clear more rubble. A banana peel is pushed away, revealing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another wire snaking out of the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secondary!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James spins to look uprange. Sees Sanborn motioning for t men to get down.  UPRANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off the wall, Owen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get behind something. Find cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soldiers scrambling to find concrete to hide behind.  JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James YANKS the wire out of the dirt but it turns out to buried like a root, and the more he rips the more the wir revealed. He rips and rips, going back ten feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ---The wire is stuck in the ground, and it will not come anymore. James digs with a knife -- FURIOUSLY moving eart until he reaches a third artillery shell, which he pulls of the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --CU knife blade inside the shell --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --CU James' helmet - glass clouding over from condensatio losing visibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --ECU blasting cap --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --ECU knife tip separates the wire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James strides uprange. Eldridge isn't sure what to make o James. Sanborn is, but not ready to show it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gulping air as the helmet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see that guy? (smiles, recovers his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I need a beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn begins the bomb suit removal ritual - unstrapping Velcro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can arrange that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He yanks at the strap - a little roughly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice southern brand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yanks at another strap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James looks down, the tone of Sanborn's voice and the for of the strap gets his attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge picks up the pieces of the suit and places them the Humvee. Listening to this exchange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd take a beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that wasn't too bad, for our first time working together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think working together is I talk to you. And you talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we going on a date, J.T.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn stands, removing the last piece of the suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we're going on a mission. And it's my job to keep you safe, so we can keep going on missions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, this is combat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that James walks to the Humvee and gets inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn closes the trunk, hard, startling Eldridge.    El comes close, speaking out of James' earshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just thirty nine days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty eight. Assuming we survive today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tick-tock. Tick-tock.   INT HUMVEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James is in the passenger seat, waiting impatiently. Sanb and Eldridge get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mean to mix it up. But the situation dictated it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious. We're gonna work together. You'll get used to my ops tempo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your ops tempo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't always stop to chat, and I like to go fast. You know, so the insurgents don't have time to plan. I don't want them make any cell phone calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Sanborn's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge and Sanborn chowing down - two guys among a sea SOLDIERS. Behind them in the mess tent hang the signs of various fast-food restaurants that cater to the troops: P HUT, SUBWAY, BURGER KING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ketchup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge passes his ketchup over to Sanborn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not Pizza Hut. (removing a slice of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is not pepperoni. It's round and meaty, but it ain't pepperoni.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goat meat, probably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goat meat pepperoni? I'd be glad if this was goat meat pepperoni.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd eat a truckload of goat meat pepperoni. No, this is something else. (slapping the fake pepperoni on the table) This is unholy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pray for something better -- and while you're at it, pray for a new team leader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you want to be the guy in the bomb suit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They see James at a food station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be better than him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James approaches the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, James.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James sits down to an awkward silence. Eldridge stops eat Considers him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was some crazy shit you pulled out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell yeah. You're either really lucky or really good. Right up on the car like that. Gun to the head. Crazy. You know it might backfire on you someday. You know that. You might actually die. And then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James is puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't meet your maker. You just get vaporized into little bits of DNA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn watches Eldridge closely. Is he referring to Thompson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to be helpful) He asks everyone what they think about death. Ever since Thompson was KIA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James nods, turns to Eldridge:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think about it. Waste of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James goes back to eating.     Eldridge keeps looking at then lets it go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Midday in Iraq. The heat is oppressive, biblical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James, Sanborn and Eldridge emerge into the blazing sun a the tumult of the base. Trucks barrel by. And troops -- everywhere, troops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James stops in front of young Iraqi KID selling pirated D while Sanborn and Eldridge continue on to the head shed. kid, whose name is PELE, has DVDs fanned on a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One for five, two for nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three for twelve?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three for thirteen. And for you, no tax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing, fishes out a five) Keep the change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn is smoking a cigarette and watching James buy DVD weighing him, when the team's FIRST SERGEANT, stocky with paternal way about him, holds out a white envelope to Sanborn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tags finally came. Figured you'd want to be the one to take them over.(handing Sanborn the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, I will handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sergeant nods. Sanborn stuffs the envelope in his bac pocket. And the Sergeant heads inside, walking past --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small office space with the door opened a crack. Behind door, Eldridge is sitting on a swivel chair, looking at a computer screen, playing a computer game. Next to him in another swivel chair is LT. COL. JOHN CAMBRIDGE, a MILITA PSYCHIATRIST, who is looking at Eldridge and the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing the jingle) "Be all that you can be," right? But what if all I can be is dead on the side of an Iraqi road?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to see you move past this feeling that you're going to die, Owen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at the screen) Why? I think it's logical. This is a war, right Doc? People die all the time. Why not me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's true. But what concerns me is how much you think about it. You have to change the record in your head, think about other things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't dwell on death.(looking at his watch) I don't obsess. You understand what I'm getting at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge looks up at last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James stands before the open door of his trailer with the satellite phone in hand. Overhead a canopy of stars blink

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the earpiece of the phone the faint but unmistaka BEEP of an answering machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, guess you're out...wherever you are you're probably wearing those tight jeans, damn those look good... Anyway, Baghdad's alright, guys are a little uptight down here, but then they just lost a brother so I understand... uh...(looking up at the stars)...really beautiful night, wish you could see these stars...miss you...bye...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He disconnects.    Sits in the darkness.   Distant WASH o engine noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn is shaving in a mirror, otherwise dressed for com and ready to go, when James shuffles in wearing a T-shirt boxer shorts, looking like he just woke up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn can't believe James is this relaxed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James starts to brush his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta talk to you about something before we roll out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James keeps brushing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesterday -- that was not cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. We'll get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More tooth brushing. Face cleaning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James notices a tatoo on Sanborn's forearm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in Military Intel for seven years. Before EOD. We ran combat missions in every shit hole on the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, smile on his face) So I'm pretty sure I can figure out a dumb trailer park redneck like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spitting out water,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like you're on the right track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn drives. James in the passenger seat. Eldridge is the gunner's turret. They ride in silence, each man alone with his thoughts.   TITLE OVER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A faded blue Opal sits by a high wall laced with concerti wire. It's at the end of a narrow cul de sac which backs the embassy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The narrow cul de sac dog-legs into another street. At th entrance to the cul de sac, there is a phalanx of SOLDIER and our EOD techs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn and Eldridge are unloading the robot from the Hum

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other soldiers are evacuating OFFICE WORKERS from the embassy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James seems frustrated with the situation - frowning into face of the SERGEANT in charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An office worker called it in. The car doesn't belong to anyone who works at the building. It's been parked there for an hour. No license plate and the suspension is sagging, so there's something heavy in the trunk -- three or four hundred pounds. Could be a bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you evacuate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're trying. But the English Ambassador said we're supposed to guarantee his safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn approaches, lap top in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bot is ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN in a Bhurka on a motorcycle rides past the Soldie and towards the Opal --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raising his rifle) Shit -- What do you want me to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't shoot her for riding a bike...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- CU the motorcyclist's hands, holding a MOLOTOV COCKTAI It's hidden from view of the soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- She rolls the cocktail under the car and darts down an ALLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car BURSTS into flames, and the scene breaks into --  PANDEMONIUM --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Eldridge frantically straps James into the suit, as th car burns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- James takes off his sunglasses, cleans them, calmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Sanborn runs to the truck and returns with a fire extinguisher, which he hands to James.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge - I want you in that window - keep the alley clear. Sanborn, cover it from the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn looks at the alley: not a happy place. Eldridge t off towards the Embassy entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMBASSADOR SIR AUCKLAND GEDDES, the epitome of the old st of British foreign service: elegant, self assured, a gentleman adventurer in Seville Row, hoping to improve th world, certain he'll profit in the attempt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's holding court with a group of EXECUTIVES. The execut are seated around a conference table under the Ambassador sway. There's a model of a British Petroleum gas station/convenience store, in English and Arabic, in the center of the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...So in sixteen months time I believe five million gallons per day is in fact rather conservative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOUNDS out the window. An Executive turns his head nervou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But security is still the big variable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ambassador brushes his hand in dismissal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only on the margins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyday, the risks diminish and the rewards multiply--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, and here is EOD. You see gentlemen, everything is fine. The site is secure. The bomb -- if there even is one -- will easily be dispensed by the crack American team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge rushes over to the window to see the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaster Mike, I'm at the window.   SANBORN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's stationed himself near the mouth of the alley.   Wis smoke and flames in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy that. How's the fire look from up there.   AMBASSADOR'S OFFICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flames a meter high, over.   JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close to the burning car. SMOKE rising from the hood and under carriage awash in FLAMES, like a sleeping dragon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James sprays the fire-extinguisher and the fire subsides. inspects the interior - looks normal enough - and tries t open the trunk with a pair of pliers, but the handle does give and snaps off under his effort. He kicks the trunk b it remains shut. He turns and lumbers up range, jaw set.   SANBORN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching James walk back uprange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaster One, what is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay put, I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing alone in the kill zone at the mouth of the alley

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good question. But I'm not liking it.   HUMVEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James is buried inside the Humvee, searching. He tosses w he doesn't need, and a succession of items comes flying o food, clothing, a tarp. Now James walks back towards the Opal without saying a word. In his hand is a crowbar.   BLUE OPAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James winds up and swings hard at the door. Wham! Nope. W Wham! Wham!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops the crowbar and tries the trunk. Presto, it open revealing: a trunk overflowing with EXPLOSIVES -- ten tim what we've seen before. James is taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all in the kill zone on this one.   SANBORN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn stares at James and the car. Great.     JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now inside the car, slipping on the slimy seats, he cuts seat cushions with his knife, and rips out the foam upholstery, and finds more bad news buried underneath: SI ARTILLERY SHELLS and a WIRE that leads to the floorboard goes under the carpeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James DIVES to the wire and cuts it, then rips open the carpet to reveal more wire -- and follows the wire throug the car, ripping apart the car PIECE by PIECE, cutting wi as he goes.   AMBASSADOR'S OFFICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An executive gets up to look out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I'm going to need you to stay away from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, please, sit down. It's safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is he here, if it's safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is just an observer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that true, we're safe here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my opinion, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Executives take this as a cue to leave. Getting up, shuff out of the room. The Ambassador is furious at Eldridge, advancing on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is idiotic. Why not tow the vehicle away from the building?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe the lane is too narrow for a Humvee, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donkeys.   Use donkeys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe we have any of those on hand, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Lord. You Americans really are incompetent. No donkeys on hand? What do you think I'm talking about, a full squadron of farm animals?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge trying to stay on task.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) Go downstairs, grab a farmer or one of those street vendors and procure - meaning purchase, buy - several donkeys. Then tow this car bomb away from my office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I'm going to need you to step away from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geddes looks out the window at the burning car.   SANBORN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His walkie barks to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over Sanborn's walkie) Lot of pink Det cord here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the switch?   JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James is now in the front seat, tearing up the upholstery

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in the front seat. Doors. Dash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WISP of smoke curls out of the heating vents. James doe notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you haven't found it yet, it's probably under the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of the cord goes under. It's up here -- somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try the weather-stripping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James rips off a chunk of weather stripping. Just bare me   SANBORN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been thirty seconds. You need to bail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can find it.   JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crawls to the back seat, slipping on the foam and slim More smoke escapes from the vents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James, seriously, you need to bail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger that. Be right out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James retraces what's left of the wire, yet again, ignori Sanborn. He sits back in the seat, strangely relaxed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shadow comes into Sanborn's sight. It's an IRAQI on a bicycle, riding straight towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incoming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn raises his rifle. The man peddles on, waving his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is the entrance to this building?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imshee! Imshee!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bicyclist looks at the car.   ELDRIDGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trains his scope on the head of the bicyclist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to burn him on three. One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geddes just looks at the big man at the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's rich. Give him a count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through Eldridge's scope the bicyclist grows.     He flic his safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaster Mike, do you copy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't make me kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been in combat very long?     SANBORN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into walkie to Eldridge) Copy that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James, you need to get out. There's another potential bomber here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So shoot him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to make a delivery down there. Please let me through.   AMBASSADOR'S OFFICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two!!   SANBORN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative, Negative. Hold your fire. (shouting at bicyclist) Get the fuck out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bicyclist does an about face, but not before casting last suspicious glance back at the car bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn refocuses on the Opal; he's losing his cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaster One, do you copy, over?     JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still sitting in the back seat. Now he sees the smoking v

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimmie a minute.   ELDRIDGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes never leaving the street below, flicks the safety of rifle back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geddes notices the sweat on Eldridge's face, and feels a sudden surge of sympathy for the younger man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well done.     That took great self control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. Again, I apologize for the intrusion into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but I doubt the insurgents will appreciate your restraint. (in a kindly, paternal tone) If I may give you a piece of free advice, next time, pull the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, actually, the uh--rules --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the only way out, I'm afraid. When you're in a losing battle, you have to draw blood. No insurgency in modern history has ever been truly defeated, so all you can do is manage your exit. Clear a wide swath of bodies so you have room to withdraw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the office door opens and a YOUNG AIDE appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The building is empty, Sir, except for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geddes nods, grabs his coat and moves to Eldridge for one last jab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to say it, but that's just how it's done. You need to show some vigor. In Kenya, we executed the insurgents in their beds, until they gave us room. Falklands, the same. That's just how it's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge looks up, he's had enough.   Swings around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that how you did it in Northern Ireland? With murder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are. Now you're showing some vigor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.T, the building is clear now. We can pull out.   SANBORN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger that. (to James) Will, we can pull out. The building is evacuated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still no answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaster One, we are cleared to leave this fucking site. Walk away. Do you copy, over?     JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay where you are, Sanborn. I'm not done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, James turns off his walkie.      CLICK.   ELDRIDGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.T., are we moving?   SANBORN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative. Negative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't copy that. Did you say negative?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger. We are staying until James is finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James, what's the situation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn, Will, I need a report.   JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James' POV. He sees in the corner of the back seat, havin just wiped away a puddle of fire retardant, a little blac box, with a wire leading out of it. He grabs the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.   BLUE OPAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black box goes flying out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn is furious, stalking ahead of James as they retur uprange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn passes Eldridge, who has come down from the ambassador's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the suit.   HUMVEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James' face looks flushed, red, sweat dripping. Eldridge begins ripping apart the Velcro from James' legs.   MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James sits in the car, smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn leans into the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, James.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn JABS him in the jaw, knocking the cigarette out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you turn off your walkie again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn stalks off and James explodes out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crouches down -- searching the floor of the Humvee. Se his cigarette, damaged and dirty on the mucky floor, but still burning. He extracts it and carefully cleans it off then jumps on the hood of the Humvee and goes back to his smoke. He's calm as can be. The Marlboro man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he puffs away, watching Sanborn converse with a group SOLDIERS, a JEEP drives up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLONEL REED jumps out wearing a uniform covered in army bling - medals he won a long time ago, before he traveled the food chain. An AIDE trots along beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points to James) That you in the bomb suit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, it was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading his name tag) You were the guy in the flaming car, Sergeant James?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James is concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well hot damn, that was some hot shit. You're a wild man, you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Colonel spins his head around to Eldridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a wild man, you know that? (back to James) Let me shake your hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Extending his meaty paw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slapping him on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many bombs have you disarmed, Sergeant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James seems slightly self-conscious.   Eldridge listens i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, I'm not sure.    A lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant, I asked you a question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One seven three.   Counting today, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit. One hundred and seventy fucking three bombs. God damn. That must be a record. So tell me, what's the best way to go about disarming one of these things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James doesn't answer as he looks at the black box. Finall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way you don't die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good one, spoken like a wild man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like a picture with this man - anybody here have a camera?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nearby soldier holds a digital camera up to his eye. Colonel Reed smiles big, arm draped around James's should SNAP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, sir, thank you very much. Sir, couldn't do it without my team (looking around for Sanborn) Hey, Sanborn! Get over here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn trots over, glowering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Col. Reed) This here is Sergeant Sanborn, the key to the whole team. (rubbing it in) And Specialist Eldridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Reed extends his hand. Sanborn is shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys should all get Bronze stars and I'm gonna recommend it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Sir.                 Thank you, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck, boys. Keep on keeping on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of earshot Colonel Reed addresses his aide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't catch me walking down on no fuckin' bomb. Hell no, you're not gonna get me in that monkey suit.   HUMVEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James sits in the front with his IPOD earphones on.   Los the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge starts to climb into the turret.    Before he do speaks softly to Sanborn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bronze star?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care, (not caring that James may overhear) the guy is not safe. You can have mine and I'll pin it on your coffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you do think I'm going to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck, Owen. I don't know. Probably not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James, Sanborn and Eldridge are discharging their weapons dry firing them into steel drums. Clicking of ammunition. Long shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James steps out, grabs a smoke, as a soccer ball rolls be him. It's Pele's. Inviting James to play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ball! Ball!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James picks it up, and carries it over to a pile of sandb and sits down. Pele runs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me my five bucks and I'll give you your ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five dollars - for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those DVDs were crap. They were so fuzzy I couldn't see a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, they were fuzzy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Hollywood, my man. Special effects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy's chutzpa amuses James. He's starting to like thi kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pele.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah - like the soccer player?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, the great Pele

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James gets up. Motions for the kid to give him space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready? One, two --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smashes the ball in Pele's direction -- it flies up. P blocks it easily, kicking high in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- three. Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pele comes back over to James, who has sat back down.   H notices the bomb patch on James' uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to the patch) So you are EOD -- boomala boomala. It's fun, no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like to disarm them. Tell   you what, kid, I'll buy another   DVD from you but if this one is   fuzzy you better watch out. Cause   I'm coming for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn and Eldridge eat together. In the corner of the r James is eating alone in a sea of soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge and the psychiatrist are back in session.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I should be pulling the trigger more often? Killing people? Bomb makers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not your mission. Your mission is to protect life. Render safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if I need to change the mission - to survive? That bicyclist I told you about? I'm ninety percent sure he was an insurgent. I could have shot him. Not my mission. But it would have been legal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to turn into an animal just to protect yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you know this from your extensive work in the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've done my field duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where was that? Yale?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Specialist, if you want to stop talking to me, you can. These sessions are voluntary. You chose to be here, talking to me, just like you chose the Army, just like you chose EOD. You're in an elite volunteer unit. Not many guys have the IQ or the nerves to do it. Be proud of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge considers this.    The psychiatrist taps his pen Waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep the soldier in the fight and the fight in the soldier, right Doc?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge puts out his hand, and they shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously, I appreciate what you're saying. But you need to get out from behind this desk more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James is watching his clothes dry as they tumble around t machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn comes in with a pile of laundry. Sees James.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn stuffs his laundry into a machine. James is still watching the drier, starts to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you ever get in my shoes and put on the bomb suit you'll see your whole mind changes when you're in front of a bomb. You lose 20 IQ points just from the weight of the suit. Your brain gets so much adrenaline that you hallucinate. Turn off the walkie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn stares straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be lucky if all you do is turn off the walkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off the spinning dryer, we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heat playing tricks with light on the ribbon of road - imaginary water pooling on the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, the auditory landscape of Baghdad: distant CALL to prayer and the incessant RAT-TAT-TAT of gunfire.     TITLE OVER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James is walking uprange with a large artillery shell. It looks very heavy and he's sweating profusely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brings the bomb to the Humvee where Sanborn and Eldrid are waiting. They're also suffering in the heat. They tak the shell from him, and stow it in the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are we on water? I'm dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.T.'s got some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm all out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're at the south end of an EXPLOSIVES DISPOSAL RANGE, nicknamed, `Purgatory' -- an empty expanse of dirt pockma with craters and bordered on one side by a small number o dwellings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM!!! A huge bomb explodes, sending dust and debris int the air in a mini mushroom cloud...We move across the fie with the cloud, and settle where our EOD team is position by their Humvee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn has a remote detonator in his hand and is about t blow it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire in the hole. Fire in the hole

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James interrupts --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on a second. I think I forgot my gloves back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James jumps into the Humvee and drives down range, revers the course we just took. It's a long way to the explosive at least half a mile, and Sanborn and Eldridge watch him recede in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James is a tiny figure, ambling around the explosives pil There's nobody else around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn looks down at the detonator in his hand. Eldridge notices the look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those detonators break all the time. Accidental misfire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that shot laid out like that, it could be a UXO that just cooks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shot that size would obliterate everything in its path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His helmet, you'd have that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, there'd be half a helmet somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And little bits of hair stuck to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little bits of hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd have to recommend a major change in techniques and protocols so that kind of accident never happens again. You'd write the first draft of the report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to write it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, are you serious about killing him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Sanborn looks up at Eldridge. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James starts driving back uprange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another dusty nowhere. The EOD team is stopped in the mid of a road that cuts through a swath of desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the roadside are several SOLDIERS and their vehicles. soldiers look sunburned, tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn and Eldridge are near the soldiers, looking down road where --   TITLE OVER:

dialogues.speaker: DAYS LEFT IN BRAVO COMPANY'S ROTATION
dialogues.text: CRATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James is inside a CRATER in the middle of the road, worki on an EIGHT-FOOT MISSILE. He attaches A ROCKET WRENCH, a metal band with two explosive tubes, to the nose of the missile -- and flips a switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two   tubes ignite like a firecracker, shooting small flames.   Then the flames grow and band spins and FLIES o ZIPPING   into the air above James' head like a metal fri landing   fifty feet away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James peers into the nose cone.    A hollow void.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James? Do you copy? James?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He climbs to the top of the crater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers are gathered around the pit to see EOD work. It's not everyday you get to see an eight foot missile to out of a hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James is down in the pit. Sanborn hands him a chain. Work together, they wrap it around the missile. When they're d Sanborn signals Eldridge, who is behind the wheel of the Humvee, ready to tow the missile out of the crater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rock it out, slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chain creaks, then stops. The tires spin uselessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try gunning it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tires only spin faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn moves to get a closer look. His knees come very n to the creaking chain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing this from the pit) Sanborn, watch that chain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KA-BOOOOM -- the sky flashes orange overhead --James flat his back, dazed. A shard of metal ZOOMS into the pit, mis him by inches -- as the soldiers dive into the pit for co shouting "RPG, RPG!"   HUMVEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge, who is in the driver's seat, starts shooting hi rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I shooting at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn jumping into the Humvee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't fucking know! -- but James is down!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fires in the same direction as Eldridge. The Humvee ge peppered with bullets. The armor holds. But it doesn't lo like it's going to last for much longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn grabs Eldridge. And they dive back into the pit, joining James and THREE SOLDIERS: a SERGEANT one PRIVATE a CORPORAL who is a SNIPER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James is sitting up, taking off his bomb suit. He appears be unharmed.   ROAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the soldiers is in the turret of a Humvee, firing big .50 machine gun in all directions.   CRATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up there with your Barret and help him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Note: Barret is the large .50 SNIPER RIFLE carried by on the soldiers, a specialty gun with an extremely long rang

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SNIPER hoists the heavy gun to the edge of the crater looks down the scope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he does, Sanborn, Eldridge, and James, and the other soldiers pop up and lay down covering fire. Then they qui pop back down.   ROAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldier in the Humvee is still churning his machine g shooting in all directions, expending hundreds of bullets minute.     CRATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see nothing out there. Chris is shooting wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Chris - can you hear me? Chill out on the fifty man.   ROAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldier in the Humvee fires a few more seconds. Picks his walkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- As a bullet hits him in the neck, killing him instantl   CRATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit. He killed Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone in the pit pops up and fires in every direction, knee-jerk response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A soldier picks up his walkie and keys it. We can't hear talking over the retorts of the soldiers firing rifles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men are pinned down, paralyzed by fear. Sniper fire f one of the buildings rakes the top of the crater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Bullets kick up sand on the far side of the crater, opposite the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Eldridge looks like he's having a heart attack. This i how it ends, he thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --James seems preternaturally calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a while --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should save our ammo at least until we can see these bastards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sergeant takes off his pack, and pulls out a pair of binoculars. Inching up to the edge of the crater, where h joins the SNIPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you see anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's got to be coming from those buildings. Somebody moved on the roof of the tall one there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
