dialogues.text: We see the buildings in the distance. They look too far a to be threatening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit him if you see him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As suddenly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SNIPER is hit in the breastbone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh fuck. Oh fuck. Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the pit: total meltdown. This is it. The day you die. Everyone starts talking at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man we got to get out of         I'll get on the Barret. here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do that J.T.               Shit. Okay. We need help

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCH, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Roger that, Alpha Nine. Go          (to Sergeant) ahead.                           Let me see those binocs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sergeant hands the binocs to James.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are taking incoming fire. I have two KIA. The grid --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James gives Sanborn a look. He leans in to say something Sanborn, which we can't hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the Sergeant's walkie:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know where you are Alpha. Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn crawls into the SNIPER's position, moving the dea body out of the way. James follows next to him to observe with the binocs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy that. Okay. Can you get us some help. (to James and Sanborn) Don't do that fellas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn is already shooting. The SNIPER RIFLE puts down bullets slowly. It has a clip of six rounds. One by one Sanborn expends them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge, I need ammo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge pulls two clips of ammunition off the bloody che of the dead sniper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking through the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're shooting high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge hands the ammo to Sanborn, who jams the clip in rifle, and then adjusts the sight. He pulls the trigger. gun jams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear it, clear it. (the clip is removed, passed to James) Eldridge clean the bullets. The blood is making them jam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge is handed the bloody clips. He pops the bullets one by one, and tries to clean them. But the blood is sti A bullet slips out of his hand, rolls down the crater. Th soldier helps him by picking up the bullet and cleaning i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James looks back to see Eldridge's progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spit on `em Eldridge. Spit. Rub. Spit rub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge is trying. He's really trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Eldridge. I need ammo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James sees that Eldridge is not getting it and he draws c to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're doing good, man. (putting his hand on Eldridge's shoulder). You're okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge nods. His mind is there but his hands are disobe him. James attempts to clear his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will keep you safe, Owen, that's my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldier hands the ammo to James.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to both of them) Alright. Scan your sectors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Eldridge positions himself so he's looking in the opposite direction that James and Sanborn are looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn fires two more rounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still high, adjust your windage. Elevation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roof of the tall building in the distance bobs in and of view. At this great range, the scope dances.     CRATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on the left by the smoke stack. Guy in white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn fires once. He turns his head away from the gun a makes an audible exhale to release tension -- the sniper breath control technique.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. There's another one just behind him. Up a meter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn fires once. Audible exhale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James scans the area. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun lower in the sky. Around the pit, the fallen sold has been pushed to one side, and the living are hanging o their sanity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge and the remaining soldier have exhausted their w supply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn and James are in EXACTLY the same position as whe left them. Focused. Sanborn's finger on the trigger. Sanb breathes out, the sniper breathing. He's been doing this an hour, time and the desert heat have taken their toll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn blinks sweat away.   SANBORN POV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scope BLURS. He regains focus.   JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noticing Sanborn's fatigue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge, grab me the juice out of an MRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge digs around the DEAD SOLDIER'S backpack and retrieves a packet of juice, which he passes to James.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James inserts the straw into the juice pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hesitates, not sure if Sanborn will accept the gesture after all the hostility that's passed between them. But h brings the straw to Sanborn's lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first, Sanborn keeps his attention on the rifle scope. then he opens his parched mouth, and sips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Suddenly, there's movement, a flutter of fabric, in the distance off Eldridge's shoulder. He stiffens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At my one o'clock. Two hundred meters. Something moved behind a parked car. Either a tan dog or a man in a light-colored shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deal with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh--Ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge looks down his scope, unsure. James keeps his fo forward on the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think it's a dog.   Should I fire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge shifts his weight onto his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a flutter of movement in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge pulls the trigger. Spraying the car in the dista Empties his entire magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From behind the car, something falls to the ground, and t tiniest sliver of a rifle clatters after it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldier in the pit comes over to Eldridge to see what he's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good hit, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James and Sanborn don't turn around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge slumps, spent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun casting long shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James and Sanborn in the same focused position. Eldridge still watches the rear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldier in the pit reaches his breaking point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to go for the Humvee. What do you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been here two hours and they ain't seen nothing. I'm going to go for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that he dashes up and out of the crater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn keeps his eye on the scope.  ROAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldier runs to the Humvee, gets in, and turns the vehicle around, driving it back to the pit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dives out of the vehicle and back to the pit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those fuckers are dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if they hit us with an RPG when we get out? What if they were just waiting for us to get in the Humvee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's safe. I'm telling you

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got those fuckers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldier jumps out of the pit. Stands in the middle of road. A sitting duck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to men in the pit) See? You got them. (turning to building,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got you mother fuckers. You're fucking dead Hajis. Haha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldier pulls down his pants and moons the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss this mother fucker!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James lowers his binocs. Sanborn lowers his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exchange a mirthful look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James and Sanborn face each other; both men are red-faced drunk, swaying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn nods. Wham! Sanborn reels back from the punch. Ja is standing over him. Glowering. He looks good. The rage like a vitamin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we're even.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn stumbles back, recovers. Around them in James' ro are the remains of an Irish wake: two bottles of Scotch, already empty. A third half gone. Cigarettes burned down an ashtray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be right back. I gotta piss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sanborn stumbles out, James turns to Eldridge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more, boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (imitating a young

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Sir, Sergeant James Sir. You're not very good drunk are you SIR!! You're a good fighter, Sir. Natural born warrior, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You acquitted yourself well on the field of battle today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? I got scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is a coward at some point in their lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn comes in. He sees a box under James' bed. Sanborn picks up the box under James' bed and plops it on the tab intentionally breaking up the love-fest between James and Eldridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Owen, look! Will has possessions! I didn't know you owned anything, Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn pulls a picture frame out of the box. It's a pict of a baby boy. Eldridge leans in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my son. A real tough little bastard. Like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James is uncomfortable with the subject. Intimacy isn't e for him. He rolls his eyes, nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she was my girlfriend, we had a baby, then she became my wife, then we got divorced. (pause) I thought we got divorced. (pause) But she's still in the house, and she says we're still together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I don't know. What does that make her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dumb, to be with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ain't dumb. She's loyal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My problem is the one girl who I like keeps talking about kids. Kids. Kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give her your sperm, stud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. I'm not ready. (looking around the box, finds a circuit board.) ) And what's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn sees there are many such parts in the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bomb parts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit. Why do you have them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James reaches into the box. Pulls out a circuit. Looks at admiringly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is from the Blue Opal. (to himself) It's wild, isn't it, to hold something in your hands that could have killed you. (he tosses the board to Sanborn)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge leans over, pulls another board out of the box. fascinated by James' obsession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this one from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (warming to the attention) That was one of our early roadside bombs we disarmed, the one with --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at the board) --it's a piece of junk from Radio Shack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James shrugs. He reaches over to get the circuit board fr Sanborn, who clearly doesn't share his fascination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, sound of BOMBS going off. The men pause listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only reason he likes you is because you act like his bitch, and you look up to him, and he likes to be the top dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree with that too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, (picking up James' pistol) The humiliation is too great to bear. (he pulls the trigger while slipping out the clip). Good-bye world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gun clicks harmlessly. Eldridge laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gust of wind rattles the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That punch was harder than I hit you. I'm owed a good one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on, we need some rules. No face shots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James lifts off his shirt, getting into fighting mode. Eldridge picks up a marker and begins to draw a bulls-eye James' stomach, stopping when he sees a cluster of scars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beauty mark, my mother dropped me at birth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like frag scars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn slugs James. James doubles over, loses his balanc and falls back. James gets up, laughing so hard it hurts. Tears of laughter falling down his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhh! Excellent. Now your turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn braces for the blow. James gets ready to strike, fakes a swing -- his fist stops just shy of Sanborn's che

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn's eyes go wide as -- James nails him with his oth hand, right in the gut -- Sanborn doubles over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like it hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving forward aggressively, suddenly James looks like he could kill. A complete change in his demeanor, as wind ro the trailer, causing the light bulb to rattle and cast a STRANGE SHADOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- then James rushes Sanborn, tackling him -- they crash the corner of the room -- in a flash James is on top of Sanborn, pinning him -- Sanborn moves to punch James but James pins his hands -- James taps Sanborn lightly on the cheek, caressing his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There there. It'll be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off of me you freak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn tries to buck James off. Forcefully raising his h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, ride me, ride me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn reaches for his boot knife. He flicks it open, br the blade to James' throat. Their eyes lock. James dismou laughing. Stumbles back to the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're alright, Sanborn. Let's have another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind is blowing harder, kicking up sand. Overhead, a moon is blazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James looks up at the moon. It's dazzling. James and Eldr support Sanborn as they weave towards Eldridge's trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge passes Sanborn off to James, and heads up the st to his trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn sags. James pulls him back. They walk a little farther to Sanborn's trailer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Here we go big boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And half carries Sanborn up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James eases Sanborn onto a cot, and as he falls onto the the WHITE ENVELOPE falls out of his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I have what it takes to get in the bomb suit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James didn't expect this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James picks up the white envelope and puts it on Sanborn' night table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks back. Sanborn is already asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole camp is asleep but James is standing outside, holding a satellite phone. He's swaying. Drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James, my God, what time is it? Are you alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm doing fine, babe. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you woke me up. But - ah - we - we're fine. (getting more lively) Will junior said "bobba" He means bottle, but he's talking, Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James looks around the camp. All he sees is its immensity the tremendous scope of the operation. This is military might, raw power. As good as it gets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. I'll call you tomorrow when you're awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, I can't wait until you come home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying his best to mean

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you call me again soon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Bye honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James hits the END button on the phone and walks up the s to his trailer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stumbles inside, drops the satellite phone down on his desk, next to his bomb suit helmet, and sinks into bed. H lies there, clothed and awake, and stares at the helmet, looking at his reflection in the polished glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then James reaches over to the helmet and lifts it up, he it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts the helmet on his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone in his bed, wearing his helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiling behind the glass, for he now he can sense the bom and feel his nearness to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the RASP of his breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn blinks awake to a painfully bright sun. He shifts attention to the white envelope on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SOLDIER wearing glasses is talking to Sanborn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remains?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Personal effects?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn reaches into his back pocket, withdraws the white envelope. He opens it. Inside are Thompson's DOG TAGS. He crumples the envelope, lets it fall to the floor. And gri the tags tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thompson, Matt. Sergeant EOD. Baker Company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at a form) Okay let me see. He's at three- three-eight. (looking) third aisle down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn turns to look, and now we see where he's standing the MORTUARY AFFAIRS UNIT, in a large room filled with wh boxes. It looks like an art installation, each white box spaced evenly in a cavernous space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll walk you over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk down the aisles, passing rows and rows of white boxes, and finally stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldier opens one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside are a pair of boots. A stack of clothes. Books. Photographs. The remains of a life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go. Did you know him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn places the tags on the uniform in the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I did. He was my team leader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk up the aisles, again passing the rows of white boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the entrance, Sanborn turns. The soldier offers his ha They shake warmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldier, a little perplexed at Sanborn's gratitude, doesn't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn leaves, notices the empty ENVELOPE on the floor. Litter. He picks it up and stuffs it back into his pocket

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James and Eldridge eat in hung-over silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a while...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tough night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wind picks up.    The whole tent shakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you supposed to be at your shrink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fired him. I said, Doc, shooting a man had a salubrious effect on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Healthy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're healthy? Well, why not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go back to eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn joins James and Eldridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up team?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They nod silently as he sits. Sluggishly he throws his ha down on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get a Huu-haa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge slaps a tired hand on top of Sanborn's. James follows suit. They wearily lift their arms in mock enthusiasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All at once:   "Huu-haa."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn wolfs down some food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going back to sleep now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get up to bus their trays. And nearing the dirty-tra bin, the flaps of the tent billow more and more vigorousl Outside, a storm is brewing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each man unfurls the checkered scarf around their neck an wraps their face for the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wind rakes sand and dust over the tent city, giving it an otherworldly aspect. Throngs of men and vehicles fight th swirl. It impedes their every move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three men continue onwards, as the intensity of the s grows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storm is HOWLING now. Visibility is reduced to a few feet. Red sand blows mercilessly. It's Mars.   TITLE OVER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they approach the head shed, a Humvee comes blasting o of the storm from the other direction. It skids to a halt front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three wounded EOD TECHS and an EOD TEAM LEADER tumble out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look awful. One step shy of death. One man's face is smeared brown. Blood oozes from a deep gash in his cheek. Another tech is covered in black soot. Their hands still clutch their weapons -- the battle still wages in their minds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting to James) It was a car bomb. Fucking nasty one -- they had a decoy detonator set up so that when I disarmed it nothing happened -- then, I'm walking back uprange to get some more tools and boooom!!! If I hadn't been wearing the suit, I'd be dead right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a Medic to look at your cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wounded TEAM LEADER touches his face and blood smears his hand...he looks down...surreal to see your own blood. The First Sergeant trots over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amazed at the sight of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no big deal. (now turning his attention back to James) ) Be careful. They're starting to hide the detonator really well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FIRST SERGEANT turns his attention to James:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to ruin your day off, but your team is up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James blinks back sand and dust blowing into his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So much for the nap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. COL. CAMBRIDGE knocks on the window. Startling the me His face appears in the sand storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you guys about to go out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind if I ride along? I'm sick to death of sitting behind a desk all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James shoots Eldridge a look.   Eldridge shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anytime, Sir. It's a privilege.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LT. COL. CAMBRIDGE gets in. As they drive out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mean to insult your intelligence, Sir. But if the shit hits the fan, please don't fire out of these windows. They're bullet proof and the round will just bounce around the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A partially destroyed building fills the screen. A mess o bricks and rebar. Wind swirls sand up into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearby, an OLD IRAQI MAN with a DONKEY drawn cart is unloading new bricks to repair the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farther up the road, a good distance from the building, a two parked Humvees. Nearby, James and his team are talkin a small cluster of SOLDIERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing back at the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right up those stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been inside already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In there? Fuck no. We've had reports of all kinds of shit coming out of that house -- and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James takes his eyes off the building and turns to the Soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James turns to Cambridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you wait here? We'll bring out anything of interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James, Sanborn and Eldridge enter a landing. The floor is very wet. They cross it, and come to a room that has been severely damaged by a bomb, with rubble everywhere and exposed electrical wires dangling from the ceiling, and busted pipes gushing water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tea pot sits on a STOVE, steaming hot, and a plate on t table has bread on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James bends the gushing pipe, stemming the flow of water trickle. Now the spitting wire hanging above the water pi looks less ominous. But not by much.   CORRIDOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue down a narrow corridor, light diminishing. switch on the lights on their M4s. The corridor ends at a door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This would be a great place to put a pressure activator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, with like twenty pounds of high explosives on it so you get anyone in the room when you open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rope trick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge uncoils rope from his pack and hands it to James who makes a lasso and tosses it over the doorknob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James yanks the rope -- we follow the rope inside through kitchen to the doorknob, watching it turn. No bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ascending a staircase. James unstraps a flash grenade fro his vest and heaves it onto the floor above. They stick their fingers in their ears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blinding FLASH and DEAFENING sound. Then silence.   No movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess no one's home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaster One, what was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, one of ours, just a flash grenade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come to a landing that opens up to the second floor.   SECOND FLOOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large cavernous space filled with what looks like Santa bomb making factory: A pile of motherboards. Batteries. B boxes. Electronics in various states of disassembly. In another corner, stacks of artillery shells. Blocks of C4 plastic explosives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the back half of the room, there is a   work table, an the table is a DEAD BODY of a young man,   wearing pants shirt. A JACKET draped is over its torso   and face. Even these hardened EOD experts, the sight is   unnerving, and copper smell of spilt blood and death is   staggering, sickening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James, Sanborn and Eldridge approach the body cautiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James pulls a retractable aluminum pole from his pack and telescopes it to its maximum length, about 10 feet, and u the pole to lift the jacket. Gently. The FACE appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All that we can determine about this face is that it is young. The distinguishing lines of the nose and cheeks ar covered by bruises and blood and further obscured by the shadows and dappled light, that it could be the face of almost any young man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The violence done to the face exerts an odd pull on James

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid at camp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sells DVDs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's not him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see him every day. He sells DVDs by the mess tent. His name is Pele.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Different kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dead young man's chest has been cut open. An artiller shell is shoved inside the cavity where the heart used to beat. Wires protrude from the shell. It's meant to be a b trap, to be placed on a street and elicit as much damage possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seen a body bomb before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James shakes his head no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn moves closer to the body and inspects the wiring the chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch it. Let's blow it.   JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Positioning three blocks of C4 on the body, then plugs blasting caps into the explosives. James nods to Sanborn Eldridge, and they leave him alone with the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James walks backwards out of the room, unspooling a roll detonation cord as he goes. But before he gets to the doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaster, we've got a hold. I'm not getting airspace clearance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy that, How long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger. Could be anything. At least 15 minutes is what they're saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you -- you need to explain to them that we don't have 15 minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger. I'll see if we can push this ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James squats down, rests his rifle, looks at the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moments pass and he feels a set of eyes on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swivels his head to the left and makes eye contact wit the dead kid on the table. The face doesn't have any of t markers of death; it looks alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James turns away, then is compelled to make eye contact again. He looks at his watch. The seconds tick by all too slowly. He grabs his walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen is not going to work. I need to do this now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger, I understand. If it was me, I would go for it, but I don't think command is going to budge under the circumstances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell command I'm in a fucking war zone. And I'm going to blow now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James gets up, clips his rifle, and takes the last few st out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blaster One, I don't know who you know, but you got your permission. Ready to det any time you say so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the door he stops to look at the dead boy on the table looks and looks. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cancel that det.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaching over the body of the boy. He pulls the artillery shell out of the boy's abdomen with his bare hands. He wi his hands on his pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Blaster One, I'm coming down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James carries the body down the staircase. The head and f bump the sides of the staircase as he descends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BODY lies on the street, James standing over it. A bl and white pickup TRUCK emblazoned with the logo of the Ir National Police pulls up to their position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of POLICEMEN get out and after a few words with Ja they load the body.     HUMVEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn and Eldridge sit across from each other, watching James.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...So you really don't think it was the DVD kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're positive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Could it be? One in a million chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Will seemed positive. But that was weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look out the window and notice Lt. Colonel Cambridge down the street surrounded by a crowd of IRAQI MEN.   CAMBRIDGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cambridge is trying to talk to several of them at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not a safe area for you. Imshee!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't leave. Cambridge lifts his rifle, not quite shouldering it. Then one MAN, mid thirties, in a suit, st forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you talk to us like children. We are not children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme a break, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cambridge, suddenly not so sure of himself, looks back to Humvee and sees --   JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching the police truck drive away. He then moves for t Humvee, motioning for Cambridge to load up.   INT   HUMVEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge guzzles some water.    Wipes sweat from his brow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then Will's pretty weird. He keeps bomb parts under his bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passing the water to Sanborn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you he doesn't put this one under his bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James cracks the door, jumps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees Cambridge walk past the brick pile that the OLD I MAN had created. The man is no longer there. Something crosses his mind when--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --The brick pile explodes in a A SICKENING BLAST, obliterating Cambridge and flipping the Humvee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --James, Sanborn and Eldridge SPIN upside down as the Hum is buffeted by the blast - landing upside down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Suddenly CAMBRIDGE'S helmeted HEAD crashes into the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Billowing smoke, dirt and debris smears the windshield blotting out the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Inside, a flurry of HANDS yank on the heavy armored Hum door. It doesn't budge.   EXT   HUMVEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SOLDIER runs to the rescue. He reaches for the Humvee d the metal sears his hand, and he pulls back in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldier uses his rifle butt to jam the door open - bu that doesn't work, because the butt doesn't catch the han From inside, the POUNDING and YELLS grow louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldier drops the rifle and grabs the searing metal w his hand, burning his flesh as he pries the handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Humvee door finally gives. Three men tumble out onto blackened sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James is standing in the doorway into the building, divid his attention between the outside and the interior -- whe Sanborn and Eldridge are slumped against a wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn stares at a blank wall. Eldridge is running his h over a cigarette lighter -- seeing how much of the flame can bear. He looks as if he's hoping the physical pain wi help put the psychic pain in perspective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James, standing in the light of the doorway, is smolderin with rage and ungovernable purpose. He's smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We stay here for a moment to watch as each man makes his deal with himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the open doorway a Humvee comes into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James stomps out his cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our ride is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn and Eldridge remain in a trance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're movin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks out into the glare. Sanborn and Eldridge rise to follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funnel of wind erases a tank tread in the sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More sand drifts and piles like snow up against a small mountain of sand bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sand disappears the windshield of a parked Abrams as day moves into night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dust. Wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James is stalking towards an OLDER IRAQI MAN who is selli DVDs at Pele's usual table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey - you haven't seen that kid around here by any chance - who sells movies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. No English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No English? Don't lie to me. Where's that kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, my man. Movie? Five dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James shakes his head and walks away, heading towards a c of SOLDIERS standing in the shade of a tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you guys responsible for this area?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That motherfucker over there (pointing to the Man) could be an insurgent, watching the camp and giving intel to his buddies so they know where to launch their mortars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's just a guy selling DVDs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a security risk. You should get rid of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The merchants are cleared. I couldn't do anything to him without the say-so from my CO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James realizes that he has no hope of prevailing. Agitate he turns away, and we stay with him as he trudges down on Victory's dusty roads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the end of the day and the DVD seller packs up his w to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James, in sunglasses, sweatshirt covering his army fatigu follows him to his car. James draws near, and points his pistol at the guy's crotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does this change anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DVD man looks stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James leans across the DVD man and flashes his ID to one two GUARDs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OGA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard looks to his buddy who mouths "CIA"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you cleared to leave the camp through this gate, Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to need to see your ID again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fuck with me man, I'm having a bad day already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard stares at James. James stares at the guard. The guard shrugs, waves James through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck goes down a series of streets. It comes into a neighborhood and stops at a house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pele.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dwelling is set back behind a low wall. Hard to see m of it in the dim light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James takes a step forward, toward the wall.  SUDDENLY--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the DVD truck peels out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James looks at its retreating tail lights. A moment of indecision as he considers his situation: alone in Baghda

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he vaults the low wall, landing in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A modest courtyard. Light comes from one window in the ho the rest is dark. Crickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James walks around to the back of the house. There's a do He tries the knob. It opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a dark hallway. Murmuring of a television. James moves towards the noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James comes to an antechamber. Behind it is a very low st archway. He goes through the archway, where -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN -- call him Kalim -- older, fifties, dressed in traditional garb, sits at a table drinking tea, watching Egyptian game show on television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James walks in, gun drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man is spooked. He spills his tea, looks wildly for a exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James puts his fingers to his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you speak English?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: English, French, Arabic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want the people responsible for Pele.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For whom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pele. The body bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pele? I don't know. But please sit down. I am professor Kalim, this is my home. You are a guest. Sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take me to the people responsible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, whatever you seek, I will help you find. Please, please sit, down. You are CIA, no? I am very pleased to have CIA in my home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James raises his gun to aim at the man's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you don't understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man is suddenly very afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, be careful. Be slow. A gun can go off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the back door opens

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- James spins to see

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- a WOMAN, older, matronly. She sees James, his gun. And starts shouting at James in Arabic, then English, "Get ou get out."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James swings his gun to her.  SUDDENLY--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- behind the woman comes Pele. He runs to his father's s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- James turns to the boy, to say something --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- his mother is rushing James now, swinging a candlestic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- he spins to the door, trying to get out of there --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- SMASHING his head on the stone archway on his way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James is shaken. He looks around, down the street. It's murky. Dangerous. Even the shadows have shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs...and runs...and we stay on his eyes. Blood runs the wound on his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOUND of far off EXPLOSION. The sky turns orange briefly, then fades into blackness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blast of bright white light floods James. He's stunned and raises his ID in his open palm over his head. A scrap blood stained fabric is wrapped around his head wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Multiple rifles suddenly trained on his upturned face. VO SLAP CONCRETE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On your knees, on your knees!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big offish GUARD walks up and slams a rifle butt into t side of James' head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He falls to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ficke, ficke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard sees the military ID splayed on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whorehouse two clicks from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I let you in, will you tell me where it is exactly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James walking along a dark camp road. He walks up to the shed porch, and goes inside. His walkie, sitting on a des comes to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I repeat, do you copy? Do you copy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm right here. What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) Just wondering if you might want to join us in the Humvee for a little outing the Army wants us to go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy that. What's you're twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're at the south gate, James. We've been waiting for you for half an hour. Where have you been? Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James jumps in. Sanborn and Eldridge shoot him impatient looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn hits the gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tanker blew up near the Green Zone about an hour ago. We're doing a post-blast on it. To figure out how the suicide bomber pulled it off. So where did you say you were again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't. Sergeant. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch the road, Owen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn looks at him, shakes his head. James stares out t window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of Humvee headlights, glowing orange in smoke fill air, come rapidly toward us. They stop, the Humvee groans idle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James' team gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk down the street, guns low, combat flashlights o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn, get the big spotlights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn doubles back to the truck, roots around in the ba comes running back with two giant flash-lights. James hit the switch. Sanborn hits the switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pool of intensely bright light opens in front of them, revealing a rubble strewn street. Concrete. Bits of glass Metal. Everything that goes into a city -- pulverized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear CRUNCHING sounds as the men walk down the street their feet fall on the blast remnants. The crunching gets louder as they walk towards a GLOWING RED INFERNO at the of the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Soldier's head, then his shoulders visible in the dista

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friendlies, coming `in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys the Medics?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we're EOD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk past, deeper into the gloom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two soldiers run past them, carrying a stretcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop to see what he's looking at. Twisted metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's an engine block. A big one, too. From a truck probably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oil tanker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what I'm thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men keep walking, and now the SOUNDS from the Inferno louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another man rushes towards them, his face shrouded in blackness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn points his rifle at the man's head. Hits him with Hi-Beam of his light. The man is wearing a black wool ski mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! Wagef! Wagef!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I am working here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn looks at him. Doesn't reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James puts his gun up on the guy. Now Eldridge does too. guy is about to be toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A face appears next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guns cover the face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then they see that above the face is a helmet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And on the top of the helmet is a COLONEL'S INSIGNIA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay fellas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Sir. I didn't recognize you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guns are lowered, fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that the Colonel is fully visible in the light we can that he's shaken by the scene of destruction around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't found a body so it could be a suicide bomber or some clever bastard that caused all this -- and slipped away to sip tea with his mommie -- we just don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Colonel struggles to define the horror he's just s James jumps in to save him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take a close look, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This kind of situation we may never know what happened. This is a mass casualty situation - terrible destruction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger that, Sir. We'll do our best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stretcher comes by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're cowards, you know. I wish they would stand up and fight us, man to man, instead of playing hide and seek with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger, Sir. We better get moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, go ahead Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Colonel nods and moves off. His translator stands for moment. Takes off his ski mask to reveal an intelligent f with deep set eyes and a dirty smear of five o'clock shad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Ahmed. My name is Ahmed. Thank you for not shooting me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men move on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Advancing toward the plume of smoke and embers rising int the sky...smell of burning rubber and charred metal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...until they see it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the twisted steel carcasses of two small vehicles and a TANKER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The image is biblical - the wounded and dead piled togeth in one Hieronymus Bosch maze of tangled limbs, body parts

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Palm trees burning at the top...like Olympic torches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOLDIERS secure the area.   GRIEVING FAMILIES swarm aroun dead and dying --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James, Sanborn and Eldridge approach. Wind fans nearby flames into a fountain of embers that float up into the b desert night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James moves through charred metal, stumbling over somethi sharp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- then something hits his leg... What? Flashlight, gun - DOWN! -- it's a CHICKEN, charred -- feathers burned off b still walking around - disoriented, dying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James stumbles sideways to avoid the charred hens...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOUNDS distant and near of wailing, MEDICS racing onto th SCENE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN wearing Bhurka appears out of the distant flames haze -- looking disoriented, in apparent state of shock -   SANBORN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BODY lies trapped beneath a pile of rubble. Sanborn rea down to remove one of the chunks of stone. It slides away but another falls in its place.   ELDRIDGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shines his light on a concrete wall, stained with what lo like threads of black lace. He draws closer. What is it? Sanborn leans in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hair.   JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approaches the woman in the Bhurka --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Hey -- you alright? -- Keef Halek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to face him...madness in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James' flashlight illuminates a massive crater, black...a empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge swirls around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James is shining his light into a orange tree. There's a PERFECTLY formed ORANGE, unharmed, nestled among the burn leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where the blast stopped. (beat) Look over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James is pointing to a building in the distance. It's pas row of houses and a field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn comes into view. James nods to him and points aga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect vantage point for a remote det -- and I bet he's out there right now watching us make fools of ourselves. We could get him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to go out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James keeps looking into the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, let's go hunting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could stand to get in some trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn stares at James and the bandage on his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, this is bullshit. You got -- what?-- three infantry platoons here. That's their job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't say No to me, Sergeant. I say No to you -- and I'm not going to let this bomber slink off while the grunts get their act together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the move) Let's go. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James glowers at Sanborn and Eldridge and stomps off, dow the alley toward an empty field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge shoots Sanborn a sympathetic glance, and follows James. Sanborn watches them recede into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn runs after them.   FIELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move three abreast across a dark field, guns raised commando-style. Poised to strike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk in silence, alert to every decibel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gravel underfoot. Enveloping night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come to a high wall, behind which the ground raises gentle hill that looks out onto the tanker.   WALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn gives James a leg up over the wall. James helps Sanborn over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lean over to pull Eldridge up but with the forty pou of gear he's got on he's too heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got to work on your pull ups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James and Sanborn drop over the other side, and we follow them as they crouch low and approach a building construct site.   WALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge pushes his back against the wall and scans the a It dawns on him that he's alone.   CONSTRUCTION SITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn and James come to the edge of the site and find w may or may not be the remains of the trigger man's camp. There's a florescent lantern still glowing and cigarette butts in a pile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That little bastard. Let's torch this spot so he can't use it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James pats his pockets down, looking for something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have an incendiary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three quick SHOTS ring out -- they sound very close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn and James instinctively fall to one knee. They sc the area -- nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As one man, they rise and start running back to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no answer.   WALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both drop to the ground on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They scan the ground with their flashlights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BODY of an Iraqi insurgent is lying close to where Eldridge had been standing. He's pulped from bullet wound and gasping for breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy comes out of the dark - Eldridge shoots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scavenges the ground looking for brass casings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three shots, close range. He takes a step forward to see what he's hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another guy comes from behind him -- gets the drop on him. You're a hostage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look up and down the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That way is towards the tanker, troops.   DARK STREET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run about fifty yards when Sanborn TRIPS, stumbles, James catches him as he falls, and they keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, they see Eldridge's back and the backs o two other MEN, just as they are turning a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They SPRINT to the corner, and pause to catch their breat James hands Sanborn his flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit `em with both lights on three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One. Two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn shoulders his rifle and readies both spotlights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They spin around the corner - flash of light revealing NOTHING but an empty street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sprint to the next block, where Eldridge is being wa quickly at gun point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men's rifles are at his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again. One two three. Do it. Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn shines the lights on the backs of both men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James fires. Three shots at the guy on the left of Eldrid Three shots at the guy on the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn kills the flashlights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James goes running towards the group, Sanborn running nex him. Both have their guns up but lights off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get to the group and all three men are on the ground Both Iraqis are dead -- shot clean in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge is bleeding profusely from his leg, but he's ali

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James and Sanborn pick Eldridge up and drudge back with h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You're fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I dead? Am I dead? Am I dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off James' face --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James walks in. The room is empty. Florescent lights hum. James is still wearing his fatigues. His whole midsection red with Eldridge's blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James heads to the shower and steps inside, fully clothed turns on the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aims the shower head to his stomach. Sinks down so it can the bloody stains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the uniform grows wet, then gets soaked, the pinkish w swirls down the drain --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James and Sanborn emerge into the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how you doing with this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine? You know I lied to our sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Eldridge wouldn't have to go around saying he was shot by his own team leader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Thanks. I'm just tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want some sleeping pills?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I'm good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James walks purposely out of the head shed toward a waiti Humvee. He passes Pele who looks up and shouts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Boomala, Boomala!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James keeps walking.    Eyes straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running up to James, holding DVD's, walks next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at these, best quality.    No special effects!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James just keeps walking.     He gets in the car, Sanborn driver's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pele watches him go.    Hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge is on a stretcher, being loaded into a military transport helicopter. Sanborn and James are there to say bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Eldridge is being loaded in, James touches his shoulde

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll probably be walking in a few months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My tibia is shattered in nine places I don't think I'm going to be walking soon. The doc said six months if I'm lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Six ain't bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad? It fucking sucks man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eldridge is jostled as he gets put down. And he cries out pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see that motherfucker. That's what happens when you shoot somebody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sorry? Fuck you, Will. (meaning it) Really fuck you. Thanks for saving my life and all but we didn't have to go hunting for the trigger man. You invented it, to get your adrenaline fix. You war mongering fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing Eldridge's hand) Take care of yourself, Owen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TRANSPORT SOLDIER looks at Sanborn and gives a hand sig to wrap it up. Time to go. The door is closed on Eldridge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James and Sanborn watch as the helicopter takes off. The rotor wash chops the air.   JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wind and sand buffet his face. He turns to say something Sanborn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's already walking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new sand storm has begun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so it's in a cloud of dusty orange air that we find James, encased in his bomb suit, taking the first steps o his trek towards...   DOWNRANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WASHING MACHINE. Sitting in the middle of the street.   TITLE OVER:

dialogues.speaker: DAYS LEFT IN BRAVO COMPANY'S ROTATION
dialogues.text: UPRANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn casts a nervous look around the poverty-stricken neighborhood. It has taken on a forboding vibe in the unrelenting storm.   DOWNRANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James approaches the washing machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (headset, impish grin) I hear ticking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He uses a long pole to open the door of the washing machi It's empty inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting closer, he sees the washing machine timer is at 3 minutes. James rests his head on the timer, listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns his attention to the back of the washing machine unscrewing the rear plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside, just a tangle of wires. He traces the wires with hand. Shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he turns back to the front of the machine. He twists timer with his hand, slowly, all the way back to zero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It DINGS -- harmlessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Sanborn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy. What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send your skivvies down here on the bot, I'll run a quick bleach cycle. Somebody threw out a perfectly good washing machine.  UPRANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --When, suddenly, the SOUND of SOLDIERS SHOUTING in the distance catches Sanborn's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hustle back, something's going on.   MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James comes back sweating profusely from his run. Sanborn helps take his helmet off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As two SOLDIERS come running over. More SHOUTING in the distance, louder now. "Hands on your head." "Don't move asshole." "Stop. Stop."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In addition, the sound of SHOUTING IN ARABIC. A loud jumb

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over that, SOLDIERS YELLING: "Get back." "Form a perimete

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NERVOUS SOLDIER trots up to James and Sanborn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a situation with a suicide bomber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll follow you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They follow the soldier down the road. The soldier is sweating, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The road has been cordoned off by SOLDIERS on all sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the middle of the road an IRAQI MAN IN A NEW BLACK SUI standing with his hands above his head. He's distraught. Hair mussed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SERGEANT seems to have taken command of the situation, now he alone is shouting to the man. "Stay still. Don't M If you keep walking we will shoot you."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TRANSLATOR in a black ski mask is helping him get the message across.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The translator edges forward to talk to the BLACK SUIT ma

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep that translator back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the soldiers grabs the translator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the soldier) But the bomb was forced on him. Against his will. He is not a bad man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James and Sanborn and the NERVOUS SOLDIER come onto the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sergeant turns to James and explains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He came walking up to our checkpoint, said he had a bomb strapped to him. He was sorry. He didn't want it to blow up. He begged us to take it off him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help this man. He's not a bad man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a bad man? You've got to be kidding me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a trap. He wants to draw people close to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him to open his jacket. I need to see the bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The translator SHOUTS in Arabic and the MAN unbuttons his jacket, revealing several sticks of dynamite strapped to chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the soldier) With that much bang, I'd need a hundred meter perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him to get on his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The translator SHOUTS. BLACK SUIT complies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we just shoot him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As James considers that option when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO. He's not a bad man. He has a family. The bomb was forced on him. He is asking for help. Only help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you one hundred meters away, like everybody else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how will I hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need to. I'm going down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, the BLACK SUIT man is SHOUTING something in Arabic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is he shouting now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's asking you to hurry. He thinks the bomb has a timer on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James turns to Sanborn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's that helmet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn pulls James aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've had our differences. Eldridge? That's water under the bridge. It happened. But this -- this is suicide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James smiles at Sanborn. He just doesn't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why it's called a suicide bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's suicide for you, Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. That guy wants to catch an American? I'll give him an American.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn reluctantly hands him his helmet, and seals him i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James grabs a nearby soldier's walkie then starts the wal downrange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soldiers moving back to their perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PEDESTRIANS gathering for a look.    Soldiers scattering quickly.   BLACK SUIT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiles thinly as James nears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James nods at him. The man nods, frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inshalla. Inshalla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James kneels down to get a closer look at the bomb strapp to the man's belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes out his 9mm and puts it on the guy's forehead. C the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I shoot you now, I can disarm this bomb much more easily. Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACK SUIT stares at him blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn, give your walkie to the translator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is this guy saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACK SUIT jabbers on in Arabic.   UPRANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The translator keys his walkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says, I don't wish to die. I have a family. Please take this off me.   JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holds his walkie up for the man to hear the translator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands have to stay behind his head or I will be very happy to shoot him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Translator conveys this to BLACK SUIT in Arabic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACK SUIT starts yelling in Arabic.   Forehead wet with sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says, please hurry he has a family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what I asked you. Now I'm going to shoot if he doesn't understand that he can't move his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James holds the walkie up to the man's ear. Translator ha another exchange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes. Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
