dialogues.text: Now James sinks to his knees and examines the bomb, all t while keeping his pistol on the man's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a FOREST OF WIRES. He pushes them aside, reveali cheap Casio digital WATCH, which is counting down from fi minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn, I need to get this rig off. There's too many wires here to figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy that, what do you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James feels around the bomb. It's strapped to the BLACK S man with heavy gauge metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man is shivering with fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bolt cutters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy that. I'll get `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got two minutes to get them and get down here.   UPRANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn is already running towards the truck when he hear James.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck. Copy that.   DOWNRANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James presses his pistol harder into the man's forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move.   UPRANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn runs to the truck. He roots around looking for th bolt cutter. At last he finds it, and comes charging out it.   DOWNRANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Casio watch is at 4:30.   SANBORN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running hard with the bolt cutters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Past a crew of soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Down the road, sprinting now. Rifle flapping.   DOWNRANGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn skids to a halt, hands James the cutters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James hands his gun to Sanborn, who holds it on the man's forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James sets to work, applying the cutters to the thick met holding the bomb to his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man is crying now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn sees the Casio. It reads 4:00

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit. You weren't kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James works the cutter blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU: Bolt Cutter. It SCRAPS futilely against the metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this made out of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case hardened steel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James doubles his effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU: Bolt Cutter. The blade bites the steel, but it doesn' give.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James squeezes with all his might.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker. What's our time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn looks at the Casio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Ok. Let me think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts the bolt cutter down on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd need an arc welder to get this off properly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think we have one of those in the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU: Casio Watch 2:30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's try the back of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn nods. Keeps the gun on the man's head. His hand i starting to shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James goes behind the man, and rips open the back of his shirt, revealing the back of the bomb. Here too it is a welded band, but the metal looks thinner. Weaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James works it with the cutter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU: Casio Watch 1:30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to bail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go. I got the suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn looks at the guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do with the pistol?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it with you, that's a good pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do you leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In forty five seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn turns, and begins running uprange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting to soldiers) Get back! Get back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers turn and run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James tries and tries to clip the metal. It's a no go. He comes around to face the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The metal is too thick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me. Help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James drops the bolt cutter, kneels down in front of the and shakes his head. That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man understands James' gesture. He reaches forward, grabbing James' suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James clubs his hand away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU: Casio Watch: 45 seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James gets up and starts running-- lumbers, really, in th suit -- as fast as he can towards a retreating Sanborn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn hears James' boots thumping towards him and crane his neck to see

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --James running, arms akimbo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --The Black Suit man stands up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- He explodes and the blast spits out fire and dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --James is nailed with shrapnel and debris, knocked over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Sanborn is blown to the ground.   JAMES POV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --through the helmet a hailstorm of particulate matter fl at 22,000 feet per second straight at us --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --chunks of molten metal hitting his stomach, stopped by SUIT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --bits of shrapnel and body parts thump into him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --dust and blood splatters the outside of his helmet   JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --CU his face: White. No movement. Total silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --blood seeps from his nose

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --then, as if overcoming great resistance, his heart turn over -- Daaaa--duuuunk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --sharp, loud inhale of breath. Like birth. The heart kic in again. Da-dunk. Da-dunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James struggles to stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks uprange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn is staggering towards the soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Humvee snakes along the desert floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traffic thickening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shadows against a dimming sky.   INT   HUMVEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn is in the passenger seat, shivering, and covered grime and dust. James, in the driver's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James looks over at Sanborn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   I hate this place

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn stares out the window at the unforgiving landscap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James passes Sanborn some Gatorade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn drinks, grateful, and puts the Gatorade down. The looks at James.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not ready to die, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bro, you're not going to die out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn shakes his head. Unconsciously, his fingers touch neck, finding the exposed area above the collar of his bo armor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another inch or two difference. Shrapnel goes zing (still touching his neck). Severs my throat. I bleed out in the sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck. If I die now, nobody will even really care. My folks, sure. But that don't count. Who else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even have a son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I'm done. I want a son, Will. I want a son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drive on in silence. Then Sanborn looks at James, as seeing him for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you do it? Take the risks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you know what I'm talking about, right? Every time we go out, you throw the dice. Live or die, you just throw `em down. You recognize that, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (softly) I do. But I don't know why. Do you know why I am the way I am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Will, I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Then after a while:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This traffic is pissing me off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know where I am but I'm lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drive on.   Dust off the desert floor blows into the WINDSHIELD --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big one. Vast, hyper-hygenic, the aisles stretching on, loaded with glistening produce. Muzac. A cathedral to consumerism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We find James walking through the supermarket, looking li new man. His hair has grown, softening his features. He's scrubbed clean, dust free, and dressed in Bermuda shorts a clashing Polo shirt. The All American Dad. A suburban softie. Pushing a shopping cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome home, son, for you are no longer in Baghdad. in the "big PX" -- America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful young WOMAN approaches him from the other end the aisle. She too, is pushing a shopping cart, and in it a small BOY. She smiles at James, and says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, you grab the barbecue sauce and I'll meet you in aisle four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And CONNIE JAMES smiles again, and pats her husband on th shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now James knows he's really home.   JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pushes the cart over to the sauce section. Down the squea clean aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His progress is impeded by an OBESE WOMAN who is mulling cat litter. Her overflowing cart blocks the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James stops. Hands tight on the shopping cart. He looks a her hard. She ignores him. Where's the 9mm when you need

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James clears his throat. She sees him. Moves her cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He continues on, walking through the cavernous space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At last, he's at the sauce section. He is rattled by the abundance after the bleakness of Iraq, and the array of choices is dizzying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --He reaches for a bottle, then pulls back, unsure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Giving up, he picks a bottle at random and tosses it in the cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James is washing the vegetables they've just bought at th grocery store. Mushrooms bob in a pool of water at the bo of the sink. James tries to clean them individually, but can't. They crumble in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's put the chicken on first and the vegetables on last, so they don't burn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James struggles with the mushrooms. Makes no reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay. (beat) You know, they're really short on bomb techs over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie knows where this is going, but she fights the inevitable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, good thing the army is hiring, and they've got so many great guys over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James wipes his hands on the dish towel and walks out. Looking at his retreating back, she accidentally knocks a glass off the counter, and it shatters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few NEIGHBORS have gathered for a barbecue in James' backyard. It's a simple, low-key affair. James is tending meat on a grill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doorbell rings. Connie rushes to open it. It's Sanbor She hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for coming. Maybe he'll listen to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know how to talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the barbecue, Sanborn finds a moment to confront J privately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is the matter with you? You got a family, kid, nice looking burgers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James studies the grilling meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, it's crazy. So how's life at home treating you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn holds up his hand. He's wearing a wedding ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made the plunge. (big smile) But I thought we were talking about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just did, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy is in a cradle, face up and wide awake. James com in to tuck him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James pulls a book of fairy tales off the shelf, flips through it. Can't read that fluff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls up a chair. Begins to play with a Jack-In-the-Bo He winds it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens it for his son. The Jack POPs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His son squeals with delight, then his eyes go wide with fear. He's not sure what to make of the bobbing clown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to settle him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's see. I bet you don't know the story of these magic boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James looks at the box. He stuffs the Jack back in and cl it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy looks up at him with a son's pure admiration. Rap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once upon a time, in a distant kingdom, there were many magic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops to think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every person had a magic box. But you couldn't tell they were magic boxes on the outside. Like this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brings the box close to the child's eyes. The boy is dazzled by the colors. He reaches out to touch it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just looks like a plain old box. Then a new king came along and told all the people, you have to give me all your magic boxes. But the people, instead of giving away their boxes decided to hide them. And they put their boxes in secret places all over the kingdom. They put them in the roads. They put them in cars. They put them in buildings. And the King said, (does a King's gravelly baritone) "Well, how am I going to get my magic boxes now?" And one of the King's men said, "We have a special Knight with special armor, and he can find the boxes. And only he.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to collect his thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this Knight gathered up all the boxes, far and wide. And sometimes - - when he wasn't sure if it was a magic box -- he opened them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James slowly opens the box, holding the clown in with his hand so it doesn't pop. Releasing it slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy giggles and reaches up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the King said to the Knight, you have done a wonderful job. I will grant you one wish. What do you wish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James thinks, struggles to find an ending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the Knight didn't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James realizes he can't finish the story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, the thing is, son. One day you'll understand that when you start out like you are now, you love everything. You love your Mommy and your Daddy. You love your bobba. You love your blanket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You even love your little crib, and these dumb toys. But as you get older some of the things you love don't seem special anymore. That bobba is one day just going to look like an ordinary plastic bottle to you. And the older you get, the more this happens and the fewer things you love. And by the time you get to be my age, sometimes you only love one -- or two -- things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With me, I think's it's one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James waits for the bus. Wearing his camo. He's alone. Hi hair is shaved again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The far off city BUS grinds its gears. James turns toward the sound when a Chevy PICKUP pulls ahead of the bus, and zooms to a stop in front of him.   INT PICKUP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanborn opens the passenger window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lost again, Sergeant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in, before I change my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drive away.   INT   PICKUP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't risk letting you on a public bus. Probably shoot the damn driver if it wasn't moving fast enough.     INT    AIRPLANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stewardess passing out glasses of water and packages of peanuts approaches James' aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you are, Sir (noticing James' uniform) Thank you for your service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your welcome, m'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stewardess smiles lovingly, and waits for an opening continue the conversation. When none comes, she moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James turns to the window. In his hand he holds a photo o his son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears well up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane's ENGINE WHINE swells and merges with--

dialogues.speaker: EXT BAGHDAD DAY
dialogues.text: --SONIC OVERLOAD:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angry drivers SHOUT in Arabic - car HORNS blare - loudspe CALL to prayer - Humvee RUMBLE - incoming CHOPPER WASH - TAT-TAT of distant gunfire --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As James' feet hit the tarmac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SOLDIER is waiting for him, with a smile on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Delta-Company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Middle-Eastern sun bathes James' upturned face lengthen into a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His pace slows...the tarmac transitions to dirt as little puffs of dust lift off his continuous passage. He is now the bomb suit and we are --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- in the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The small CLUSTER of SOLDIERS at the side of the road par to make way for James.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands pat his back as he begins the long walk down the st -- toward the bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All SOUND telescopes down to just James' BREATHING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the view through James' eyes: the outside world of sold and Baghdad seems to pulsate with excitement --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- James' face. As the SOUNDS of his breathing grow loude

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- The noon day sun beats brilliantly onto a car's windshield, the glass shimmering.   TITLE OVER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- James moves into the path of that reflected sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And vanishes into the glare.   END
